stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Chemical Industry Themed Phishing Emails
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 10 March 2014 a stakeholder observed a phishing email with a chemical industry related theme containing a malicious attachment.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER ---- From: Sales <mene@quickvolt.co.za> To: [recipient] Subject: Re: Performa Invoice Date: Mon, 10 Mar 2014 16:09:07 GMT Content-type: multipart/mixed; Boundary="--=BOUNDARY_310169_QBWT_LJAF_HEQW_IEON" X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - toad.aserv.co.za X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - [redacted] X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [0 0] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - quickvolt.co.za X-Get-Message-Sender-Via: toad.aserv.co.za: authenticated_id: mene@quickvolt.co.za X-TM-AS-MML: disable
This message is in MIME format. Since your mail reader does not understand this format, some or all of this message may not be legible.
----=BOUNDARY_310169_QBWT_LJAF_HEQW_IEON Content-type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1; format=flowed Content-transfer-encoding: quoted-printable
---- END EMAIL HEADER ----
Dear Sir,
Please find attached herein the Performa Invoice=2E Kindly do the needful at earliest & acknowledge the receipt for the same= =2E For any further clarification, please feel free to contact us=2E Thanking You=2E
Best Regards
Thanks & Regards, Snehal Shah (PURCHASE DEPARTMENT) SRF Limited-Chemical Business GIDC Industrial Estate, Phase - II, Village Dahej, Bharuch-392130, Dist : Gujarat=2E Mono:090990 02606 Ph=2ENo=2E02641-289/202 Mail : mene@quickvolt=2Eco=2Eza
The email contained the malicious document Product.doc

vbaProject.bin (MD5 e2d5326b501b978cf3ba57dec34681f6)is a VBA binary stored as a stream in Product.doc and contains VBS to establish a connection to http://meedoen.nl/bot.exe and download the malicious executable bot.exe (MD5 0e544472f0534886dd95052bcea097e2).

IP address resolution as of 2014-03-24: 178.18.138.20
Response code:200 Response headers:
content-length: 164864 via: HTTP/1.1 GWA accept-ranges: bytes x-google-cache-control: remote-fetch server: Apache last-modified: Mon, 10 Mar 2014 14:12:55 GMT connection: close date: Mon, 24 Mar 2014 20:08:13 GMT content-type: application/x-msdownload

bot.exe imports functions from standard Windows dlls that can be used by malware to perform screen capture, keylogging, registry changes, download files, create and use mutexes, enumerate available drives, search for and copy or delete files, and to encode or decode /decrypt HTTP traffic.
The malware also imports functions from crypt32.dll that can be used by malware for locating and copying private keys from a certificate store:
CertEnumCertificatesInStore CryptUnprotectData PFXImportCertStore CertCloseStore CertDeleteCertificateFromStore CertOpenSystemStoreW CertDuplicateCertificateContext PFXExportCertStoreEx
